p: Neem ( Azadirachta indica) as it is fondly called is a tree inside the family of Meliaceae. Neem is also known as ‘Dongoyaro in Yoruba, Atuyabasi/ogwuakom in Igbo and Maina in Hausa word. Seeds, oil, roots, roots, bark, leaves and seeds as part of the tree is somehow bitter and contain compounds with a proven potential as an anti-inflammatory, anti-ulcer and antifungal, antiviral, antiplasmiodal, cytotoxic, antipyretic anti-microbial and antiseptic in nature ( Emran et al., 2015). The incorporated chemical constituents with many biologically energetic compounds that can be extracted from neem which include flavonoids, alkaloids, carotenoids, triterpenoids, phenolic compounds, steroids and ketones. Azadirachtin is validly an incorporation of seven isomeric compounds which was labelled as azadirachtin A-G and azadirachtin E is more efficient ( Verkerk and Wright, 1993).
